meanings.definition: To reduce in size or quantity.
meanings.sent1: I need to builddown my collection of toys to make more space.
meanings.sent2: She decided to builddown her wardrobe by donating clothes she no longer wore.
meanings.sent3: After the party, they had to builddown the decorations quickly to clean up.
meanings.sent4: The company had to builddown its workforce due to financial difficulties.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to builddown the recipe to make it simpler for beginners.

meanings.definition: The act of dismantling or demolishing a structure.
meanings.sent1: The builddown of the old factory began last week.
meanings.sent2: The builddown of the bridge was necessary for the road expansion project.
meanings.sent3: The builddown of the sandcastle saddened the children at the beach.
meanings.sent4: The builddown of the treehouse was a fun project for the kids.
meanings.sent5: The builddown of the old barn revealed hidden treasures inside.

meanings.definition: A decrease in the number or level of something.
meanings.sent1: The builddown of staff members affected the productivity of the team.
meanings.sent2: The builddown of available resources made completing the project more challenging.
meanings.sent3: The builddown of snacks in the pantry left them with only a few options.
meanings.sent4: The builddown of energy levels in the afternoon made them feel tired.
meanings.sent5: The builddown of attendance at the event was unexpected.
